subject: Re: [junit] Running tests in some specified sequence
msgSnippet: So said  Vladimir Bossicard  on  2002-09-23 ... some ... The ... There is also OrderedTestSuite in GSBase (http://gsbase.sourceforge.net) which allows you to
messageBody:
So said Vladimir Bossicard on 2002-09-23

>> These unit tests can be run in any sequence, however: I'd like to
>specify
>> that the unit tests for the lower level APIs should be run first.
>> When these tests pass, the higher level APIs can be tested, having
some
>> confidence that the lower level works.
>
>JUnit-addons has an OrderedTestSuite that could solve your problem.
The
>tests are "alphabetically" executed.

There is also OrderedTestSuite in GSBase
(http://gsbase.sourceforge.net) which allows you to specify the order
of some of the tests in your TestCase and let the others be specified
in whatever order JUnit sees fit.

J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
